forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. South southwest wind 8 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny, with a high near 60. South southwest wind 8 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dusk settles over Downtown San Francisco, the cloudy skies weave a blanket of soft gray across the city, a harbinger of the evening's impending rain. Tonight, the atmosphere feels muted and contemplative, with an air temperature lingering around a mild 54 degrees. The winds, gentle yet persistent from the south-southwest, stir the cool air, creating a sense of quiet movement that hints at changing weather patterns. The chance of rain stands at a modest forty percent, teasing the possibility of light showers. Should the droplets make their appearance, they are expected to come down softly, perhaps just a whisper of moisture—less than a tenth of an inch—a mere caress upon the concrete and canvas of the storied streets.

Tomorrow beckons with a tantalizing mix, offering a fifty percent chance of rain amid moments of fleeting sun. Daylight will unfold with temperatures climbing near 60, a scene shaded by varying clouds that may give way to slivers of blue skies. As the day breaks, layers will be key; a cardigan or lightweight jacket might suit one well as the brisk breeze exists in playful contrast to warmer, sheltered spots. These conditions invite a palette of activities: a meandering stroll along the waterfront or a visit to local cafes where the warmth of coffee mingles with the scent of baked goods—perfect for watching the world go by as the day unfurls. Whether it's the intricate street art, the sun-dappled parks, or simply the embrace of the local culture, San Francisco remains as ever, a city alive with the spirit of exploration, even in the most unassuming of weathers.
